bio: This is Emily. I have 99% consumer satisfaction.

instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Divide ground beef into 4 equal portions and shape into patties.
Season patties with salt and pepper.
Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until fully cooked.
Toast buns on the grill for 1-2 minutes.
Assemble burgers by placing patties on buns, and topping with cheese, lettuce, tomato, ketchup, and mustard.
Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add flour and whisk until smooth.
Gradually stir in chicken broth and milk, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add cooked chicken and mixed vegetables to the skillet, and stir to combine.
Pour mixture into a pie dish.
Place the second pie crust on top of the dish and seal the edges.
Cut slits in the top crust to vent.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.
Cook egg noodles according to package instructions.
Season beef with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned, then remove from skillet and set aside.
Add onion, garlic, and mushrooms to the skillet, and cook until softened.
Add beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Stir in sour cream and return beef to skillet.
Simmer until heated through.
Serve beef mixture over egg noodles.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Rub salmon fillets with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
Grill salmon, skin-side down, for 5-6 minutes, then flip and grill for another 2-3 minutes, or until cooked through.
In a medium bowl, combine mango, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno pepper, lime juice, and cilantro.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve salmon with mango salsa.

bio: I'm John, a passionate chef with over 15 years of experience.

instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F.
Mix together garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Rub the spice mixture onto the ribs.
Place ribs on a baking sheet and cover with foil.
Bake for 2 1/2 hours, or until tender.
Remove the ribs from the oven and brush with BBQ sauce.
Grill the ribs for 10 minutes per side, or until crispy and charred.
Serve hot with extra BBQ sauce.
Place chicken pieces in a large bowl and pour buttermilk over them.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Dip each chicken piece in the flour mixture, making sure it's fully coated.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Fry chicken pieces in batches for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Drain chicken on a wire rack or paper towels.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, heat milk until warm, then stir in melted butter and egg.
Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a shaggy dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8-10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Fold in raisins and knead for another 2-3 minutes.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a towel, and let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and shape into a loaf.
Place the loaf in a greased loaf pan, cover with a towel, and let rise for another 30-60 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake the bread for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped.
Cool the bread in the pan for 5-10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

bio: Thomas is an experienced chef who has worked in top-rated restaurants. His dishes are known for their unique flavor combinations and beautiful presentation.

instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Grill salmon for 5-6 minutes per side, or until fully cooked.
In a medium bowl, combine mango, red onion, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, lime zest, and salt.
Serve the grilled salmon with the mango salsa on top.
Marinate chicken breasts in buttermilk for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 200°F.
In a shallow dish, mix together flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
In another dish, beat eggs.
Remove chicken from buttermilk and coat in flour mixture.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then coat in flour mixture again.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Fry chicken until golden brown on both sides and cooked through.
Transfer chicken to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven.
Prepare waffles according to package instructions.
In a small saucepan, melt butter and mix with maple syrup.
Serve chicken and waffles together with maple butter.
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook macaroni according to package instructions and drain.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add flour and whisk until smooth.
Gradually stir in milk and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add shredded cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Combine cooked macaroni with cheese sauce, and pour into a baking dish.
Sprinkle bread crumbs over the top of the dish.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.

bio: I'm Ethan, and I've been cooking professionally for 12 years. I specialize in Southern comfort food with a modern twist.

instructions: Marinate chicken breasts in buttermilk for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 200°F.
In a shallow dish, mix together flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
In another dish, beat eggs.
Remove chicken from buttermilk and coat in flour mixture.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then coat in flour mixture again.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Fry chicken until golden brown on both sides and cooked through.
Transfer chicken to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven.
Prepare waffles according to package instructions.
In a small saucepan, melt butter and mix with maple syrup.
Serve chicken and waffles together with maple butter.
Preheat the oven to 375°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish with butter or cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, eggs, melted butter, and honey.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, heat milk until warm, then stir in melted butter and egg.
Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a shaggy dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8-10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Fold in raisins and knead for another 2-3 minutes.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a towel, and let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and shape into a loaf.
Place the loaf in a greased loaf pan, cover with a towel, and let rise for another 30-60 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake the bread for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped.
Cool the bread in the pan for 5-10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

bio: David has worked in the culinary industry for over 15 years, specializing in BBQ and Southern cuisine.

instructions: Preheat oven to 250°F.
Rub pork shoulder with salt and pepper.
Place pork shoulder in a roasting pan and cover with barbecue sauce.
Cover pan with aluminum foil and roast for 6-8 hours, or until pork is tender and falls apart easily.
Shred pork with two forks.
Serve pulled pork on hamburger buns, topped with extra barbecue sauce.
Cook grits according to package instructions.
Stir in butter and milk.
Keep grits warm.
In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Remove bacon from skillet and set aside.
Add shrimp, green onions, and garlic to the skillet.
Cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
Add chicken broth, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to the skillet.
Bring to a boil and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in bacon and shrimp.
Serve shrimp and sauce over warm grits.
Preheat oven to 475°F.
Place pizza dough on a floured surface and roll it out into a circle.
Spread tomato sauce over the pizza dough, leaving a small border around the edge.
Top with shredded mozzarella cheese and fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle olive oil over the top of the pizza and sprinkle with salt.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

bio: Hi, I'm Karen! I'm a passionate chef with over 10 years of experience in cooking up delicious, classic American dishes.

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook macaroni according to package instructions and drain.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add flour and whisk until smooth.
Gradually stir in milk and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add shredded cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Combine cooked macaroni with cheese sauce, and pour into a baking dish.
Sprinkle bread crumbs over the top of the dish.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
In a large bowl, marinate chicken pieces in buttermilk for at least 1 hour.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Dredge each chicken piece in the flour mixture until fully coated.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken pieces to the skillet and cook for 8-10 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove chicken from skillet and let rest on a paper towel-lined plate for a few minutes before serving.
Divide ground beef into two equal portions and shape each portion into a 1/4-inch thick patty.
Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of each patty.
Grill or fry the patties over medium-high heat until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F.
Add a slice of American cheese to one of the patties during the last 30 seconds of cooking, allowing it to melt.
Toast the hamburger bun on the grill or in a toaster.
Spread ketchup and mustard on the inside of the top and bottom bun.
Place the cooked patty with cheese on the bottom bun, followed by pickles and onion.
Top with the remaining patty and serve immediately.
